quotes.quote: This strategy represents our policy for all time. Until it's changed.
Strategy is a pattern in a stream of decisions
Strategy and culture should have breakfast together.
The entrance strategy is actually more important than the exit strategy.
Strategy and timing are the Himalayas of marketing. Everything else is the Catskills.
Strategy is a steps which makes you spammer or genius.
Strategy will compensate the talent. The talent will never compensate the strategy.
No matter how brilliant your mind or strategy, if you're playing a solo game, you'll always lose out to a team.
Strategy is choosing to perform activities differently, or to perform distinctly different activities than rivals.
A strategy delineates a territory in which a company seeks to be unique.
Our strategy in going after this army is very simple. First we are going to cut it off, and then we are going to kill it.
Strategy is about stretching limited resources to fit ambitious aspirations.
Strategy is a commodity, execution is an art.
A bad strategy will fail no matter how good your information is and lame execution will stymie a good strategy. If you do enough things poorly, you will go out of business.
Strategy is worthless unless you can act on it.
Strategy is about making choices, trade-offs; it's about deliberately choosing to be different.
Strategy is not the consequence of planning, but the opposite: its starting point.
Strategy is all very well, but it pays to give thought from time to time to the results.
Strategy is buying a bottle of fine wine when you take a lady out for dinner. Tactics is getting her to drink it.
That strategy of racing for the top five and racing for the win is where everybody wants to be.
Strategy requires thought, tactics require observation
Strategy means making clear-cut choices about how to compete.
Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
The transition strategies are more important than understanding what the outcome state will be.
Alter strategies and tactics, but never your principles.
Strategy is important, but trust is the hidden variable. On paper you can have clarity around your objectives, but in a low-trust environment, your strategy won't be executed.
Strategy is just a winning value proposition, that is, a product or service that customers simply want more than the other options out there.
Strategy should evolve out of the mud of the marketplace, not in the antiseptic environment of an ivory tower.
The essence of strategy is choosing what not to do.
Strategy is about shaping the future.
